docs.title: BeerXML Standard
docs.text: Reviving and maintaining the BeerXML standard for brewing recipes and data.

docs.title: Project Goal
docs.text: This repository aims to: 1. Preserve the original BeerXML 1.0 standard. 2. Clarify the specification with readable documentation and reference implementations. 3. Validate existing and new BeerXML files against the strict standard. 4. Evolve the standard into a modern, semantic version (BeerXML v2.0) in the future.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
• spec/: The specification documents.
    • v1.0/: BeerXML 1.0 (Legacy)
      • v1.0.md: Markdown specification.
      • beerxml-1.0.xsd: Original XSD.
    • v1.1/: BeerXML 1.1 (Draft) - Modern "Clean XML" evolution.
      • RFC_01_goals.md: Design goals for v1.1.
      • beerxml-1.1.xsd: Strict schema for v1.1.
      • v1.1.md: Markdown specification.
    • legacy/: Original documentation files from beerxml.com.
  • lib/: Python reference library for parsing and validation.
  • tests/: Validation scripts and test runners.
  • samples/:
    • v1.1_sample.xml: Example of the new modern XML format.
    • original/: The original samples from beerxml.com.
    • corrected/: Fixed versions of the original samples.
    • brewtlery_unetice_realworld_sample.xml: A real-world example from modern software.
  • scripts/: Utility scripts.

docs.title: Contributing to BeerXML
docs.text: First off, thank you for considering contributing to the BeerXML standard! It is community involvement that keeps open standards alive and relevant.

docs.title: Our Mission
docs.text: To maintain a stable, unambiguous, and modern data exchange format for the brewing community, ensuring compatibility across software and hardware.

docs.title: 1. Reporting Issues
docs.text: If you find a bug in the specification (e.g., an inconsistency in the XSD) or a bug in the provided tooling (Python library/scripts), please open an Issue on GitHub.

docs.title: 2. BeerXML Improvement Proposals (BIP)
docs.text:
For significant changes to the standard (like adding new tags or major version bumps), we follow a process similar to Python's PEPs or Rust's RFCs.

  1. Draft: Create a new Markdown file in proposals/BIP-XXXX-description.md.
  2. Discuss: Open a Pull Request to discuss the proposal with the community.
  3. Prototype: If applicable, provide a sample XML file and an updated XSD.
  4. Acceptance: Once a consensus is reached, the proposal is merged and scheduled for the next minor or major version release.

docs.title: 3. Improving Documentation
docs.text: The Markdown specifications in spec/ are auto-generated from the XSDs. To improve the descriptions: 1. Modify the <xs:documentation> tags (once added) or the comments in the .xsd files. 2. Run python3 scripts/xsd_to_md.py to regenerate the documentation.

docs.title: 4. Code Contributions
docs.text: We welcome improvements to: * lib/: The reference implementation. * scripts/: Migration and documentation tools. * tests/: Adding more real-world brewing samples to our test suite.

docs.title: Technical Standards
docs.text:
• Version 1.0: Strictly preserved for legacy compatibility. No changes allowed except for documented clarifications.
  • Version 1.1+: Must follow "Clean XML" principles (strict typing, ISO dates, UTF-8).
  • Testing: All changes must pass the validation suite: 
    export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:.
python3 tests/validate_samples.py

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: Please be respectful and constructive. We are all here because we love brewing and software!

docs.title: BeerXML 1.0 Specification
docs.text: This document is a reproduction of the original BeerXML 1.0 standard found at beerxml.com.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: BeerXML is a free, fully defined XML data description for exchanging beer brewing recipes and other brewing data. It was designed to allow recipes to be exchanged between different brewing programs, and also to allow recipes to be posted on the web and read by brewing programs.

docs.title: General
docs.text:
• XML Standard: All BeerXML files must be 100% compliant with the W3C XML standard.
  • Encoding: The default encoding is ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1). UTF-8 is also supported and recommended for international compatibility.
  • Case Sensitivity: XML tags are case sensitive. All BeerXML tags are strictly UPPER CASE.
  • Versioning: The current version is 1.0. All major records include a <VERSION> tag which must be set to 1 or 1.0.

docs.title: 2. Formats and Units
docs.text: Unless otherwise specified, all BeerXML 1.0 files use the following standard units. Programmers must convert to these units when reading/writing files.

docs.title: Units
docs.text: Measurement Unit Notes Weight Kilograms (kg) Example: 1.5 (= 1.5 kg) Volume Liters (l) Example: 20.0 (= 20 liters) Temperature Celsius (°C) Example: 68.0 (= 68 °C) Time Minutes Example: 60.0 (= 60 min) Pressure Kilopascals (kPa) Used for carbonation. Acidity pH Color SRM Standard Reference Method Specific Gravity 1.000 format Relative to water at 4°C

docs.title: Data Formats
docs.text:
• Record Set: A list of records (e.g., <HOPS>...</HOPS>).
  • Record: A single item (e.g., <HOP>...</HOP>).
  • Text: Standard character data.
  • Integer: Whole numbers (e.g., 5).
  • Boolean: TRUE or FALSE.
  • Percentage: Expressed as a percentage, not a decimal (e.g., 5.5 for 5.5%, not 0.055).
  • List: A distinct set of text options (e.g., "Boil", "Mash").

docs.title: Hop Record (<HOP>)
docs.text:
Used within a <HOPS> record set.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the hop. VERSION Yes Integer Version of the standard (Should be 1). ALPHA Yes Percentage Alpha acid percent (e.g., 5.5). AMOUNT Yes Weight (kg) Amount of hops used in Kilograms. USE Yes List Boil, Dry Hop, Mash, First Wort, Aroma. Note: Aroma is usually for steep/whirlpool. TIME Yes Time (min) Time in minutes (boil time or dry hop time). NOTES No Text General notes. TYPE No List Bittering, Aroma, Both. FORM No List Pellet, Plug, Leaf. BETA No Percentage Beta acid percent. HSI No Percentage Hop Stability Index. ORIGIN No Text Place of origin (e.g., "UK", "US"). SUBSTITUTES No Text Suggested substitutes. HUMULENE No Percentage Humulene level. CARYOPHYLLENE No Percentage Caryophyllene level. COHUMULONE No Percentage Cohumulone level. MYRCENE No Percentage Myrcene level.

docs.title: Fermentable Record (<FERMENTABLE>)
docs.text:
Used within a <FERMENTABLES> record set. Includes grains, extracts, and sugars.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the fermentable. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). TYPE Yes List Grain, Sugar, Extract, Dry Extract, Adjunct. AMOUNT Yes Weight (kg) Amount in Kilograms. YIELD Yes Percentage Percent yield (dry basis) or efficiency. e.g., 78.0. COLOR Yes Color (SRM) Color in SRM. ADD_AFTER_BOIL No Boolean TRUE if added after the boil (late addition). Default FALSE. ORIGIN No Text Country or place of origin. SUPPLIER No Text Supplier or brand. NOTES No Text Notes. COARSE_FINE_DIFF No Percentage Difference between fine and coarse grind yield. MOISTURE No Percentage Moisture content. DIASTATIC_POWER No Lintner Diastatic power in Lintner degrees. PROTEIN No Percentage Protein content. MAX_IN_BATCH No Percentage Recommended max percentage in a grain bill. RECOMMEND_MASH No Boolean TRUE if mashing is recommended. IBU_GAL_PER_LB No Float For extracts: IBU contribution per gallon per pound.

docs.title: Yeast Record (<YEAST>)
docs.text:
Used within a <YEASTS> record set.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the yeast. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). TYPE Yes List Ale, Lager, Wheat, Wine, Champagne. FORM Yes List Liquid, Dry, Slant, Culture. AMOUNT Yes Weight/Vol Amount of yeast (liters for liquid/starter, kg for dry). AMOUNT_IS_WEIGHT No Boolean TRUE if amount is weight (kg), FALSE if volume (liters). LABORATORY No Text Lab name (e.g., "Wyeast"). PRODUCT_ID No Text Product ID (e.g., "1056"). MIN_TEMPERATURE No Temp (°C) Min optimum temperature. MAX_TEMPERATURE No Temp (°C) Max optimum temperature. FLOCCULATION No List Low, Medium, High, Very High. ATTENUATION No Percentage Apparent attenuation percent. NOTES No Text Notes. BEST_FOR No Text Styles this yeast is best suited for. TIMES_CULTURED No Integer Number of times cultured/reused. MAX_REUSE No Integer Recommended max reuse count. ADD_TO_SECONDARY No Boolean TRUE if added for secondary fermentation.

docs.title: Misc Record (<MISC>)
docs.text:
Used within a <MISCS> record set. For non-fermentables (Irish Moss, Spices, etc.).

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the item. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). TYPE Yes List Spice, Fining, Water Agent, Herb, Flavor, Other. USE Yes List Boil, Mash, Primary, Secondary, Bottling. TIME Yes Time (min) Time in minutes used. AMOUNT Yes Weight/Vol Amount. AMOUNT_IS_WEIGHT No Boolean TRUE if weight (kg), FALSE if volume (liters). USE_FOR No Text Description of use (e.g., "Clarity"). NOTES No Text Notes.

docs.title: Water Record (<WATER>)
docs.text:
Used within a <WATERS> record set.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the profile. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). AMOUNT Yes Volume (l) Volume of water. CALCIUM Yes ppm Calcium (Ca) in parts per million. BICARBONATE Yes ppm Bicarbonate (HCO3) in ppm. SULFATE Yes ppm Sulfate (SO4) in ppm. CHLORIDE Yes ppm Chloride (Cl) in ppm. SODIUM Yes ppm Sodium (Na) in ppm. MAGNESIUM Yes ppm Magnesium (Mg) in ppm. PH No pH pH of the water. NOTES No Text Notes.

docs.title: Style Record (<STYLE>)
docs.text:
Used within a <STYLES> record set.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the style. CATEGORY Yes Text Category name (e.g., "English Pale Ale"). VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). CATEGORY_NUMBER Yes Text Category number (e.g., "8"). STYLE_LETTER Yes Text Style letter (e.g., "A"). STYLE_GUIDE Yes Text Name of the guide (e.g., "BJCP 2004"). TYPE Yes List Lager, Ale, Mead, Wheat, Mixed, Cider. OG_MIN Yes Gravity Minimum Original Gravity. OG_MAX Yes Gravity Maximum Original Gravity. FG_MIN Yes Gravity Minimum Final Gravity. FG_MAX Yes Gravity Maximum Final Gravity. IBU_MIN Yes IBU Minimum IBU. IBU_MAX Yes IBU Maximum IBU. COLOR_MIN Yes Color Minimum Color (SRM). COLOR_MAX Yes Color Maximum Color (SRM). CARB_MIN No Vol Min Carbonation (Volumes of CO2). CARB_MAX No Vol Max Carbonation. ABV_MIN No Percentage Min Alcohol by Volume. ABV_MAX No Percentage Max Alcohol by Volume. NOTES No Text Description of the style. PROFILE No Text Flavor/Aroma profile. INGREDIENTS No Text Typical ingredients. EXAMPLES No Text Commercial examples.

docs.title: Equipment Record (<EQUIPMENT>)
docs.text:
Used within an <EQUIPMENTS> record set, or nested in a recipe.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the equipment profile. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). BOIL_SIZE Yes Volume (l) Volume of the wort before the boil. BATCH_SIZE Yes Volume (l) Target volume after boiling/cooling. TUN_VOLUME No Volume (l) Volume of the mash tun. TUN_WEIGHT No Weight (kg) Weight of the mash tun (for heat calculation). TUN_SPECIFIC_HEAT No Float Specific heat of tun material (Cal/gram-deg C). TOP_UP_WATER No Volume (l) Water added to fermenter. TRUB_CHILLER_LOSS No Volume (l) Volume lost to trub/chiller. EVAP_RATE No Percentage Evaporation rate per hour of boil. BOIL_TIME No Time (min) Normal boil time. CALC_BOIL_VOLUME No Boolean TRUE if boil volume is calculated automatically. LAUTER_DEADSPACE No Volume (l) Volume lost in lauter tun deadspace. TOP_UP_KETTLE No Volume (l) Water added to kettle before boil. HOP_UTILIZATION No Percentage Efficiency adjustment for hop utilization (100% is normal). NOTES No Text Notes.

docs.title: Mash Step Record (<MASH_STEP>)
docs.text:
Used within a <MASH_STEPS> record set.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the step. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). TYPE Yes List Infusion, Temperature, Decoction. INFUSE_AMOUNT No Volume (l) Volume of water to infuse (for Infusion steps). STEP_TEMP Yes Temp (°C) Target temperature for this step. STEP_TIME Yes Time (min) Duration of the step. RAMP_TIME No Time (min) Time to reach the step temperature (rise time). END_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature at the end of the step (for decoction/temp steps). DESCRIPTION No Text Text description of the step. WATER_GRAIN_RATIO No Float Ratio of water to grain (qt/lb or l/kg, usually informational). DECOCTION_AMT No Volume (l) Amount to decoct (for Decoction steps). INFUSE_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature of the infusion water.

docs.title: Mash Profile Record (<MASH>)
docs.text:
Used within a <MASHS> record set, or nested in a recipe. Contains <MASH_STEPS>.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the profile. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). GRAIN_TEMP Yes Temp (°C) Initial grain temperature. MASH_STEPS Yes Record Set List of <MASH_STEP> records. NOTES No Text Notes. TUN_TEMP No Temp (°C) Initial tun temperature. SPARGE_TEMP No Temp (°C) Target sparge temperature. PH No pH Target mash pH. TUN_WEIGHT No Weight (kg) Weight of tun (overrides Equipment). TUN_SPECIFIC_HEAT No Float Specific heat (overrides Equipment). EQUIP_ADJUST No Boolean TRUE if software should adjust temps for equipment thermal mass.

docs.title: Recipe Record (<RECIPE>)
docs.text:
Used within a <RECIPES> record set. This is the top-level record for most files.

Tag Req? Format Description NAME Yes Text Name of the recipe. VERSION Yes Integer Version (Should be 1). TYPE Yes List Extract, Partial Mash, All Grain. STYLE No Record The <STYLE> record for this recipe. EQUIPMENT No Record The <EQUIPMENT> record used. BREWER Yes Text Brewer's name. ASST_BREWER No Text Assistant brewer's name. BATCH_SIZE Yes Volume (l) Target size of finished batch. BOIL_SIZE Yes Volume (l) Starting size of boil. BOIL_TIME Yes Time (min) Boil duration. EFFICIENCY No Percentage Brewhouse efficiency (e.g., 72.0). HOPS No Record Set List of <HOP> records. FERMENTABLES No Record Set List of <FERMENTABLE> records. MISCS No Record Set List of <MISC> records. YEASTS No Record Set List of <YEAST> records. WATERS No Record Set List of <WATER> records. MASH No Record The <MASH> profile used. NOTES No Text Recipe notes. TASTE_NOTES No Text Tasting notes. TASTE_RATING No Float Rating (e.g., 0-50). OG No Gravity Measured Original Gravity. FG No Gravity Measured Final Gravity. FERMENTATION_STAGES No Integer Number of fermentation stages. PRIMARY_AGE No Time (days) Time in primary. PRIMARY_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature in primary. SECONDARY_AGE No Time (days) Time in secondary. SECONDARY_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature in secondary. TERTIARY_AGE No Time (days) Time in tertiary. TERTIARY_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature in tertiary. AGE No Time (days) Time in aging/bottle. AGE_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature for aging. DATE No Text Brewing date. CARBONATION No Vol Carbonation (volumes of CO2). FORCED_CARBONATION No Boolean TRUE if forced carbonated. PRIMING_SUGAR_NAME No Text Name of priming sugar. CARBONATION_TEMP No Temp (°C) Temperature for carbonation. PRIMING_SUGAR_EQUIV No Float Conversion factor to corn sugar (1.0 = corn sugar). KEG_PRIMING_FACTOR No Float Factor for kegging (usually 0.5 of bottling amount).

docs.title: Appendix A: Optional Extensions for Display
docs.text:
These tags are optional and used primarily for displaying converted units or calculated values.

Tag Description EST_OG Estimated Original Gravity EST_FG Estimated Final Gravity EST_COLOR Estimated Color IBU Estimated IBU (Bitterness) IBU_METHOD IBU Formula (Rager, Tinseth, Garetz) EST_ABV Estimated Alcohol by Volume ABV Measured Alcohol by Volume ACTUAL_EFFICIENCY Calculated efficiency based on OG/FG CALORIES Calories per serving DISPLAY_BATCH_SIZE Batch size with units (e.g. "5.0 gal") DISPLAY_BOIL_SIZE Boil size with units DISPLAY_OG OG with units DISPLAY_FG FG with units DISPLAY_PRIMARY_TEMP Primary Temp with units DISPLAY_SECONDARY_TEMP Secondary Temp with units DISPLAY_TERTIARY_TEMP Tertiary Temp with units DISPLAY_AGE_TEMP Age Temp with units CARBONATION_USED Description of carbonation used DISPLAY_CARB_TEMP Carbonation temp with units

docs.title: Credits
docs.text: The BeerXML 1.0 standard was originally created by: * Brad Smith (BeerSmith) * Drew Avis (StrangeBrew) * Michael Taylor * Andrew Perron * David Johnson

docs.title: Philosophy
docs.text: BeerXML 1.1 aims to be a strict, modern, and unambiguous revision of BeerXML 1.0. It maintains the XML structure to ensure ease of adoption for developers with existing BeerXML support, but eliminates the parsing ambiguities that plagued the original specification.

docs.title: 1. Data Types & Strictness
docs.text:
• Problem in v1.0: Fields defined as "Floating Point" in the spec often contained string units in reality (e.g., <IBU>34.2 IBU</IBU>). This forced developers to write custom string parsers for numeric fields.
  • Solution in v1.1: All numeric fields MUST contain only raw numbers.
    • Valid: <IBU>34.2</IBU>
    • Invalid: <IBU>34.2 IBU</IBU>

docs.title: 2. Units of Measurement
docs.text:
• Problem in v1.0: Units were implicit (kg, Liters) but Appendix A introduced "Display Fields" (like DISPLAY_AMOUNT) which encouraged redundant data and drift. Worse, developers often parsed these string fields instead of the canonical numeric fields, or wrote units directly into numeric fields.
  • Solution in v1.1:
    • Strict Canonical Units: All weights are Kilograms (kg). All volumes are Liters (l). All temperatures are Celsius (C).
    • No Display Hints: The Data Layer is not the Presentation Layer. It is the responsibility of the consuming application to convert 0.02835 kg to 1 oz if the user prefers Imperial units. We explicitly remove all "Display" tags to prevent data drift and ambiguity.

docs.title: 3. Date Format
docs.text:
• Problem in v1.0: Dates were free-text (e.g., 3 Jan 04, Jan 3, 2004).
  • Solution in v1.1: All dates MUST use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
    • Example: <DATE>2004-01-03</DATE>

docs.title: 4. Character Encoding
docs.text:
• Problem in v1.0: Defaulted to ISO-8859-1.
  • Solution in v1.1: File encoding MUST be UTF-8.

docs.title: 5. Namespaces & Versioning
docs.text:
• Problem in v1.0: No namespace protection.
  • Solution in v1.1:
    • Root element must specify version: <RECIPES version="1.1">
    • Consider XML Namespaces: <RECIPES xmlns="http://beerxml.com/v1">

docs.title: Example Comparison
docs.text:
Legacy v1.0 (Ambiguous): 

<RECIPE>
  <NAME>My Stout</NAME>
  <DATE>3/1/2024</DATE>
  <IBU>35.5 IBU</IBU> 
</RECIPE>

Proposed v1.1 (Clean): 

<RECIPE version="1.1">
  <NAME>My Stout</NAME>
  <DATE>2024-03-01</DATE>
  <IBU>35.5</IBU>
</RECIPE>

docs.title: MashStep Record
docs.text:
Tag Type Required Description NAME Text Yes VERSION Decimal Yes Fixed Value: 1.1 TYPE mashStepType Yes Values: Infusion, Temperature, Decoction INFUSE_AMOUNT Decimal No STEP_TEMP Decimal Yes STEP_TIME Decimal Yes RAMP_TIME Decimal No END_TEMP Decimal No DESCRIPTION Text No WATER_GRAIN_RATIO Text No ## Changes from v1.0

The following changes have been made to modernize and clarify the standard:

  1. Namespace: All v1.1 files must use the namespace http://beerxml.com/v1.1.
  2. Strict Numeric Types: Fields that represent numbers (e.g., AMOUNT, TEMPERATURE) must now be pure XML decimals or integers. They cannot contain units (e.g., use 5.5 not 5.5 kg).
    • Rationale: This simplifies parsing and removes ambiguity. Units are strictly defined by the standard (kg, Liters, Celsius, etc.).
  3. Strict Date Format: All dates must be in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
    • Rationale: v1.0 allowed loose text dates which caused interoperability issues.
  4. Booleans: Boolean fields must be true or false (lowercase recommended, though XML Schema allows 1/0).
  5. Removal of Display Tags: All DISPLAY_* fields (e.g., DISPLAY_AMOUNT, DISPLAY_TIME) have been removed.
    • Rationale: Formatting for display is the responsibility of the application, not the data interchange format.
  6. Removal of Ranges: _RANGE fields (e.g., OG_RANGE) in Styles have been removed where _MIN and _MAX fields already exist.
